intro: Calotis xanthosioidea, commonly known as the yellow calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It has small, lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Calotis xanthosioidea is often found in coastal areas and is a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
